title: Interpret margin of error of sunscreen use survey

content.prompt: Based on the estimate and the margin of error, which of the following is an appropriate conclusion?

choices.label: Approximately 1% of all the people living in the region were surveyed.
Between 18% and 20% of all the people living in the region were surveyed.
All possible samples of the same size will result in between 18% and 20% of those surveyed indicating they regularly use sunscreen.
The probability is 0.01 that a person living in the region will use sunscreen when going outdoors.
It is plausible that the percent of all people living in the region who regularly use sunscreen is 18.5%.

topic.text: 6.2: Constructing a Confidence Interval for a Population Proportion

skill.text: Skill 4.D: Justify a claim based on a confidence interval.
